titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.repository: University of Delaware Special Collections Department Morris Library, 181 South College Avenue Newark, DE 19717-5267

bioghist.p: Robert Bennett is a professor of English at the University of Delaware. Along with his colleague Dr. John Wristen, he played a major role in charting and maintaining the portion of the 190-mile Mason-Dixon Trail that passes through the greater Newark, Delaware, area. He is also actively involved in local environmental organizations.

scopecontent.p: This set of papers relates specifically to the establishment of portions of the tri-state long-distance trail, the Mason-Dixon Trail System, and the Christiansted Trails. The material includes correspondence, minutes, agenda, directories, and newsletters of the Mason-Dixon Trail System, Inc. (1986-2007), as well as newspaper clippings, maps, notes, and printed material related to the trail or local environmental issues.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
